metadata.title: CVE-2023-52524 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: net:nfc: llcp: Add lock when modifying device list The device list needs itsassociated lock held when modifying it, or the list could become corrupted,as syzbot discovered.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52524` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-171-generic - 5.4.0-171.189
linux-image-5.4.0-171-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-171.189
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-171-generic - 5.4.0-171.189
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-171-lowlatency - 5.4.0-171.189
No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-94-generic - 5.15.0-94.104~20.04.1
linux-image-5.15.0-94-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-94.104~20.04.1

No subscription required
